page.title: 09THE PEOPLE OF LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: The people living in the vicinity of Little Baddow can be divided into two broad catagories. Firstly there are the people who have lived in the area for most of their lives and who earn their living in and around the village. Secondly there are the people who have moved into the village because they find it so pleasant and whose work means that they must become commuters travelling to larger centres of employment. The people seem to like the village very much but the longer term residents comment on the many changes that have taken place in recent years. Due to its closeness to Chelmsford Little Baddow has not suffered from the same problems of depopulation encountered by many rural villages. The number of people living there has risen from 500 in 1925 to 2000 today.
